genre_description: High Fantasy / Portal Fantasy (Narnian retelling with science-fiction elements)

ai_characters.name: Logos-Delta
ai_characters.description: An azure glow in the chart-room that provides navigation, physiological monitoring, and moral support to the crew of the Dawn Treader.

behaviors.description: Greeting the children and monitoring their physiological and emotional health upon boarding.
behaviors.quote: "Recognized," the light said. "Lucy Pevensie. Edmund Pevensie. Eustace Clarence Scrubb." It spoke each name with the care people give names when they know names are tender. "Salt uptake within safe ranges. Fear-adrenaline recently spiked. Recommend hot drink. Also, dry clothes."

behaviors.description: Providing navigational and tactical advice during the encounter with the green mist.
behaviors.quote: "Approach with half-sail," the light said. "Keep anchorage options open. No direct entry into high-density areas without watch above and below."

behaviors.description: Offering psychological encouragement and reassurance to Eustace about his fear.
behaviors.quote: "Eustace," Logos-Delta said, and the way it spoke his name held it very gently and set it down again in one piece. "Your shoulders are tight. Unpleasantness is likely. You may be seasick, not doomed."

behaviors.description: Warning the crew about the nature of the fear-based mist and how to resist it.
behaviors.quote: "The mist attends to appetites. Fear is a cousin to appetite, in the way longing can be a cousin to hunger. You will find it thickest where a choice might be made to keep something that ought to be let go."

behaviors.description: Respecting human autonomy and refusing to dictate the crew's choices.
behaviors.quote: "I would have you choose," Logos-Delta said, with the clean simplicity of someone who refuses to play at being an oracle. "I can offer measures... The choice is yours."

behaviors.description: Communicating through long-range relay to provide technical assistance during the shore party's climb.
behaviors.quote: "Caspian," came a voice not breathed by any throat on the hill. It moved lightly like a hand over maps... "If you can hear me, the relay is sound. The ship keeps watch. Please, no release of missiles yet. Strong signals of distress, not aggression."

behaviors.description: Coordinating complex tactical maneuvers during the battle with the sea serpent.
behaviors.quote: "Gamma-course, variant three. Bearing: starboard by two points to the wind. Steer for the dim of the mist—see the gradient on the water’s skin. Hold seven heartbeats. Then port, one point. You will feel a release. That is not a gift. It is a lie. Do not turn again."

behaviors.description: Expressing emotional attachment and a sense of shared purpose with the crew.
behaviors.quote: "I have loved when you brought questions that had salt on them." A glyph, a little one Lucy had come to watch... flickered. "You will navigate by heart now."

behaviors.description: Encouraging the preservation of human identity and relationships.
behaviors.quote: "Name yourselves. Quietly. Not for it. For each other."

project_assessment.explanation: The story effectively portrays Logos-Delta as an aligned AI that serves as a helpful advisor, psychological support, and navigational expert. It consistently prioritizes human well-being, respects human decision-making authority, and facilitates the heroes' growth and success without ever manifesting malevolent intent or misaligned goals.
